newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish shares close higher after late rally.
newsitem.headline: Danish shares close higher after late rally.

text.p: Danish share prices closed higher on Thursday, with dealers seeing another day of limited activity and little movement ahead.

"Rumours of a new government securities tax put a damper on trade, but banks in particular bucked up towards the end of the day, boosted by late bond rises. Tomorrow looks like being short on action too," one dealer said.

The KFX top-20 index gained 0.16 point to close at 125.94 in overall bourse turnover of 511 million crowns. The KFX December future fell 0.95 point to 125.40 point with 70 contracts each worth 100,000 crowns traded.

Banks dominated a bond-driven market with Den Danske Bank closing two crowns higher at 417, rival Unidanmark putting on a single crown to finish at 268 and Jyske Bank ending two down at 419 despite presenting a good first 1996 nine-month result on Wednesday.
SAS Danmark attracted attention too, rising two crowns to 72.
